questions_and_answers.question: What specific strategies are discussed during the workshop to develop a healthy campus atmosphere and promote a positive attitude towards adolescents?
questions_and_answers.answer: Strategies discussed include creating supportive environments, fostering open communication channels, implementing mental health awareness programs, and promoting peer support networks. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Can you elaborate on the curriculum of the workshop, particularly the sessions focused on understanding normal and abnormal adolescent behavior?
questions_and_answers.answer: The curriculum includes sessions on adolescent developmental stages, common behavioral patterns, warning signs of mental health issues, and techniques for differentiation between normal and abnormal behavior. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Could you provide examples of the basic counseling skills that participants acquire during the workshop?
questions_and_answers.answer: Participants learn active listening, empathy, non-verbal communication, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills to effectively support adolescents in distress. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How are participants trained to identify individuals in need of support and to refer them promptly?
questions_and_answers.answer: Participants undergo training on recognizing signs of distress, conducting assessments, and understanding the appropriate referral pathways to mental health professionals or support services. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: In the sessions addressing psychiatric disturbances in young people, what particular topics or disorders are covered, and how are they addressed with compassion and without stigma?
questions_and_answers.answer: Topics may include depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation, self-harm, substance abuse, and eating disorders. These are addressed with empathy, sensitivity, and emphasis on reducing stigma through education and awareness. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Can you explain how the workshop aims to minimize problems in young people while facilitating their maximum growth?
questions_and_answers.answer: The workshop focuses on early intervention, building resilience, fostering positive coping mechanisms, and providing support networks to mitigate problems and promote healthy development in adolescents. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What methodologies or interactive approaches are utilized during the workshop to ensure effective learning and engagement among the participants?
questions_and_answers.answer: Methodologies may include group discussions, case studies, role-playing exercises, interactive presentations, and experiential learning activities to encourage active participation and knowledge retention. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How are real-life case studies or scenarios incorporated into the workshop to enhance participants' understanding and application of the concepts discussed?
questions_and_answers.answer: Real-life case studies and scenarios are presented to illustrate practical applications of counseling techniques, crisis intervention strategies, and referral processes in various situations involving adolescents. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Are there any guest speakers or experts invited to share their insights or experiences during the workshop sessions? If so, what are their areas of expertise?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, experts in adolescent psychology, counseling, psychiatry, and suicide prevention may be invited to share their knowledge, experiences, and best practices in addressing adolescent mental health issues. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Following the workshop, what measures or support systems are in place to ensure that participants can continue applying the knowledge and skills they have acquired in their respective roles or professions?
questions_and_answers.answer: Post-workshop support may include ongoing mentorship, access to resources and referral networks, follow-up training sessions, and opportunities for professional development and networking within the mental health community. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What is the primary focus of Abhyuday regarding the participation of first-year students in its initiatives?
questions_and_answers.answer: Abhyuday focuses on ensuring the participation of first-year students in all its initiatives to engage them in meaningful activities besides their academic studies. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Why is it particularly important for Abhyuday to encourage participation in creative and recreational pursuits among first-year students?
questions_and_answers.answer: It is important because most students tend to give up such pursuits during their pre-university days, and Abhyuday aims to reintroduce and promote these activities among them. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Can you elaborate on Abhyuday's Primary preventive programme, Mission Prerana for Change, and its objectives?
questions_and_answers.answer: Mission Prerana for Change is a value-added program aimed at first-year students in the Physics cycle. It seeks to fulfill Abhyuday's vision by providing a platform for students to engage in meaningful activities and personal growth. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How frequently was Mission Prerana for Change held, and what was its duration?
questions_and_answers.answer: Mission Prerana for Change was held every Wednesday afternoon for 150 minutes in the open-air auditorium Sadananda. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How many students were typically accommodated in each session of Mission Prerana for Change?
questions_and_answers.answer: Each session accommodated 500 students at a time, organized into groups of 25 for effective facilitation. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Who were the individuals involved in facilitating Mission Prerana for Change, and how were they trained?
questions_and_answers.answer: Mission Prerana for Change was facilitated by a committed band of Prerana faculty and volunteers who were trained to assist in the planned syllabus for the students. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What was the objective of Mission Prerana for Change @ Induction, held in the first fortnight of August 2019?
questions_and_answers.answer: The objective was to introduce Mission Prerana for Change to over 1000 first-year students with the active assistance of trained faculty facilitators and first-year teachers. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Who designed and executed Mission Prerana for Change @ Induction, and what role did they play?
questions_and_answers.answer: Professor Shalini K. Sharma designed and executed Mission Prerana for Change @ Induction, presumably taking a leading role in its planning and implementation. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How was Mission Prerana for Change @ Induction different from the regular Mission Prerana for Change sessions?
questions_and_answers.answer: Mission Prerana for Change @ Induction was a special program designed to introduce the initiative to a larger group of first-year students at the beginning of their academic year, likely with a modified curriculum or focus. questions_and_answers.question: What impact did Mission Prerana for Change and Mission Prerana for Change @ Induction have on the participating students?

questions_and_answers.answer: Students are encouraged to become 'givers' by engaging in avenues for personal growth, working with juniors or peers, providing guidance and assistance, and eventually becoming mentors themselves. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.answer: 'Pride Abhyuday' aims to orient interested juniors to dynamic programming from their first year onwards, especially those selected by Super Dream companies. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How does the department support the formation and running of various clubs by students?
questions_and_answers.answer: The department ignites student initiative by helping them structure and run clubs, guiding them to ensure they serve their intended purposes effectively. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Can you provide examples of some clubs formed under the department's initiatives and their respective purposes?
questions_and_answers.answer: Some clubs include Kalanjali (Dance), ClicZ (Photography), Aura & Hands of Hope (Community service), Grey Matter (Quiz), Thorana (Event management), and many others, each serving specific purposes. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.answer: Yuj for Life focuses on improving student well-being by addressing issues such as stress, dysmenorrhea, asthma, and concentration through activities in hostels, sister institutions, and nearby schools. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What is the policy followed by Abhyuday regarding students' options after being placed in service-based companies?
questions_and_answers.answer: Abhyuday permits only students with very good academic scores to pursue options in 'Dream' or 'Core' companies, particularly those recruiting in large numbers. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How is this policy communicated to students, and when do they become aware of it?
questions_and_answers.answer: The policy is shared with students as they enter the campus as freshmen, allowing them to make informed decisions about their academic performance and career aspirations. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: Can you explain the criteria for students to be eligible for options in 'Dream' or 'Core' companies?
questions_and_answers.answer: Students with a CGPA of 8.25 or above are typically eligible to apply for positions in 'Dream' or 'Core' companies, reflecting a high level of academic proficiency. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What happens if a student with a placement offer from a large recruiter is subsequently selected by a core company?
questions_and_answers.answer: If a student is selected by a core company, they may choose to forego the previous offer and remain with the core company instead of the dream company. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: How was the policy amended in 2016, and what changes were made?
questions_and_answers.answer: In 2016, amendments were made to include very prestigious brands as 'Super Dream' companies, providing students with additional opportunities for career advancement. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What criteria must a student meet to be eligible for consideration by a 'Super Dream' company?
questions_and_answers.answer: A student selected by a Dream Company becomes eligible for a 'Super Dream' company after successfully clearing a series of tests and interviews conducted by the college. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What feedback have recruiting companies provided about Abhyuday students?
questions_and_answers.answer: Recruiting companies have consistently praised Abhyuday students for their pragmatic, professional, and ethical conduct, contributing to a positive image for the college. For more info, refer to https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/placement.php.
